topic: Uncovering the heart of my Nana’s saltwater stories

ideas.title: The Great St Kilda Pier Crab Conspiracy
ideas.premise: Nana's saltwater stories reveal a secret society of St Kilda Pier crabs controlling Melbourne's weather through interpretive dance.
ideas.why_funny: Absurd premise; Melbourne weather is unpredictable; crabs are unexpectedly sophisticated.

ideas.title: Brunswick Baths Mermaid Mafia
ideas.premise: Nana recounts her days as a mermaid enforcer at the Brunswick Baths, collecting debts in seaweed and enforcing synchronized swimming rules.
ideas.why_funny: Juxtaposition of tough mafia with the absurdity of mermaids in a public pool.

ideas.title: The Yarra River Monster's Dating Profile
ideas.premise: Nana's saltwater stories feature a lonely Yarra River monster creating a dating profile, seeking love (and maybe a good feed of discarded kebabs).
ideas.why_funny: Relatable dating struggles combined with the grossness of the Yarra River.

ideas.title: Luna Park's Ghost Train Sea Serpent
ideas.premise: Nana reveals the Luna Park Ghost Train is powered by a grumpy sea serpent who demands payment in fairy floss.
ideas.why_funny: Unexpected reason for the Ghost Train's existence; fairy floss as payment is silly.

ideas.title: The Brighton Bathing Box Pirate Treasure
ideas.premise: Nana's saltwater stories lead to a treasure hunt among the Brighton Bathing Boxes, revealing the treasure to be a lifetime supply of sunscreen.
ideas.why_funny: Anti-climactic treasure; very practical; relatable to Australian sun protection.

ranking: The Great St Kilda Pier Crab Conspiracy

winner: The Great St Kilda Pier Crab Conspiracy
